description: A unique name for your deployment. Note that Kubernetes resources can't contain capital letters or special characters. Enter a name that uses only lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens or periods.
name: deployment-name

description: The size of the disks available to the monitoring daemonset. The daemonset consists of 3 pods that maintain a map of the storage resources in your cluster and monitor the health of your deployment. The default value is '20Gi'.
name: mon-size

description: The storage class to use when dynamically provisioning devices for the monitor pods.
name: mon-storage-class

description: The amodevices provide application storage in your cluster. Each OSD is a raw block storage device that can be a local disk on your worker node or dynamically provisioned when you deploy ODF. In VPC clusters, your OSD block storage devices are dynamically provisioned by using the Block Storage for VPC driver. In Satellite clusters, you can use local volumes on your worker nodes, or dynamically provision block storage devices by using a block storage driver that supports dynamic provisioning. In Classic clusters, the OSD block devices are local disks on your worker nodes. When you deploy ODF, each device is mounted by an OSD pod. The total storage that is available to your applications is equal to the osdSize multiplied by the numOfOsd. The OSD The default value is '100Gi'.
name: osd-size

description: The storage class to use when dynamically provisioning devices for the monitor pods.
name: osd-storage-class

description: The number of OSDs. The default value is '1'.
name: num-of-osd

description: The IP addresses of the worker nodes where you want to deploy ODF. The minimum number of worker nodes is 3.
name: worker-nodes

description: Set to 'true' if you want to upgrade the ODF version.
name: odf-upgrade

description: The billing type for your ODF configuration.
name: billing-type

description: The IBM COS regional public endpoint.
name: ibm-cos-endpoint

description: The IBM COS access key ID (HMAC keys).
name: ibm-cos-access-key

description: The IBM COS secret access key (HMAC keys).
name: ibm-cos-secret-key

description: IAM API Key for storage secret.
displayname: IAM API Key for storage secret
name: iam-api-key
